history.content: I haven't taken 61C yet, so if someone has feel free to add on to this. I took 16A with 61A and math 53 and found it managable, but if you struggled with 16A the first time, be prepared to have to spend quite a bit of time on the homeworks.
I haven't taken 61C yet, so if someone has feel free to add on to this, but if you struggled with 16A the first time, be prepared to have to spend quite a bit of time on the homeworks.

Hey all, I am a rising sophomore, intended cs, and i have taken cs61a, cs61b, math 1a, and took ee16a p/np so far. This summer I plan to do the equivalent of math 1b at my community college while auditing cs70. I took ee16a p/np because I went into the class without knowing any linear algebra nor circuits and I got quite wrecked. I'll be doing it again because of the lower div requirement.

I just finished my phase 1 for fall 2018 and enrolled in cs61c and ee16a with Classic r44 to satisfy my R&C B requirement and the historical breadth. ClassR44 is a 5 unit course and I heard there are a LOT of readings, but the professors will be interesting so it's worth taking. 

How doable is 61c and ee16a together? Does anyone have any feedback on these two classes together? I read other posts that it's doable, but what's the work load like? I know 16a will have weekly homework that take roughly 6-8 hours. I don't know about cs61c.

I need at least a B+ in CS70, which I'm delaying so I can prepare as much as I can, given it IS the hardest prereq for declaring cs. To further prepare, I plan to be taking the pre70 decal in fall 2018 along with those classes ^^. In spring, I plan to take ee16b to work on my math maturity and the pre70 decal again so I don't forget the 70 material. After having taken ee16a and ee16b(to work on my math maturity), I'll be taking cs70 in next summer, summer 2019 so I can decalre cs before junior year begins. 

If anyone has taken cs61c and ee16a together, can you post what you thought of it? What other classes were you in while taking those classes? What are your thoughts on my plan for the next academic year until I declare cs? Thanks!
